        <div class="pageTitle"> 
         <h1 class="syndicate"> Protect Your Child from Injury </h1> 
         <img id="content_contentImage" class="icon-image" alt="" src="/HealthTopics/glmedia/icons/protectyourchildfrominjury.jpg"> 
        </div>

           <div id="the-basics" class="topic_area"> 
            <h2 class="topic_area_title syndicate">The Basics</h2> 
            <div class="pages"> 
             <div class="page" id="page_326"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">The Basics: <span>Overview</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <p>Children are at high risk for injuries.&nbsp;But there are things you can do to lower the chances that your child will get hurt.</p>
               <p>Leading causes of injury and death for children include:</p>
               <ul>
                <li>Car crashes</li>
                <li>Drowning</li>
                <li>Accidental poisoning</li>
                <li>Fires</li>
                <li>Suffocation</li>
                <li>Falls</li>
               </ul>
               <p>The good news is that you can help prevent injuries from events like these by taking simple safety steps.</p> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_topic_navigation_0" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNextLabel_0" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNext_0" class="button next" href="#the-basics_2">Simple Steps</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageRange_0" class="content_page_range">1 of 8 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_428"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">The Basics: <span>Simple Steps</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <h3>Prevent injuries inside and outside your home.</h3>
               <p>Be prepared and learn&nbsp;basic steps to protect your child.</p>
               <ul>
                <li>Use a car seat, booster seat, or seat belt that’s right for your child’s size and age – on every trip.</li>
                <li>Teach your child to swim&nbsp;and closely watch your child in or&nbsp;near&nbsp;water.</li>
                <li>Keep medicines, vitamins, and cleaning products where your child can’t see or reach them.</li>
                <li>Use smoke alarms. Make and practice a fire escape plan for your&nbsp;home.</li>
                <li>Make sure your child wears the right safety gear (like a helmet or pads) when playing sports or doing other physical activity.</li>
                <li>Protect your baby during sleep. Keep soft objects (like pillows, blankets, crib bumpers, or toys) out of&nbsp;the crib. Always put babies to sleep on their back.</li>
               </ul> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_topic_navigation_1" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNextLabel_1" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNext_1" class="button next" href="#take-action_1">Car Safety</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pagePrevLabel_1" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pagePrev_1" class="button previous" href="#the-basics_1">Overview</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageRange_1" class="content_page_range">2 of 8 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
            </div> 
            <div class="clear"></div> 
           </div> 
           <div id="take-action" class="topic_area"> 
            <h2 class="topic_area_title syndicate">Take Action!</h2> 
            <div class="pages"> 
             <div class="page" id="page_328"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">Take Action: <span>Car Safety</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <h3>Keep your child safe in the car.</h3>
               <p>Make sure your child is always buckled in.</p>
               <ul>
                <li><a href="http://www.safercar.gov/parents/CarSeats/Car-Seat-Safety.htm" target="_blank">Choose a car seat or booster seat</a> that’s right for your child’s size <strong>and</strong> age – and for the car.</li>
                <li><a href="https://www.nhtsa.gov/equipment/car-seats-and-booster-seats#install-inspection">Get your child’s safety seat inspected</a> by a certified child passenger safety technician. The technician will show you how to&nbsp;install and use the car seat the right way.</li>
                <li>Have kids age 12 and under ride in the back seat. Make sure they are always buckled in correctly.</li>
               </ul>
               <p>Set a good example.</p>
               <ul>
                <li>Always buckle your seat belt when you drive or ride in a car.</li>
                <li>Never drive after drinking alcohol or using drugs.</li>
                <li>Never look at your phone while&nbsp;driving.</li>
                <li>Follow the speed limit and keep a safe distance between your car and the cars ahead of you.&nbsp;</li>
               </ul>
               <p>Learn more:</p>
               <ul>
                <li><a href="https://www.nhtsa.gov/road-safety/child-safety" target="_blank">Get tips for keeping your child safe in and around cars</a>.</li>
                <li><a href="https://www.cdc.gov/MotorVehicleSafety/Child_Passenger_Safety/CPS-Factsheet.html" target="_blank">Get the facts on child passenger safety</a>.</li>
               </ul> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_topic_navigation_0" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNextLabel_0" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNext_0" class="button next" href="#take-action_2">Water Safety</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrevLabel_0" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrev_0" class="button previous" href="#the-basics_2">Simple Steps</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageRange_0" class="content_page_range">3 of 8 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_329"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">Take Action: <span>Water Safety</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <h3>Protect kids in and near water.</h3>
               <ul>
                <li>Never leave young kids alone in the bathtub – not even for a second. If you have to answer the phone or doorbell, take them with you.</li>
                <li>Teach your kids how to float, and sign them up for swim lessons as soon as they are ready. This can be as early as age 1.</li>
                <li>If there's a pool where you live, be sure it has a fence around all 4 sides. The fence should separate the pool from the house and yard.</li>
                <li>Watch your kids closely at the pool and beach. <a href="/HealthTopics/Category/parenting/nutrition-and-physical-activity/swim-safely-quick-tips">Follow these tips for safe&nbsp;swimming</a>.</li>
                <li>Make sure your kids wear a life jacket when boating. Use life jackets that fit well and are approved by the U.S. Coast Guard. <a href="https://www.safekids.org/sites/default/files/documents/how-to-choose-the-right-life_0.pdf">Find out how to choose the right life jacket [PDF - 1.5 MB]</a>.</li>
                <li><a href="http://www.cdc.gov/HomeandRecreationalSafety/Water-Safety/waterinjuries-factsheet.html" target="_blank">Get more tips to protect your kids from drowning</a>.</li>
               </ul> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_topic_navigation_1" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNextLabel_1" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNext_1" class="button next" href="#take-action_3">Poisons</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrevLabel_1" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrev_1" class="button previous" href="#take-action_1">Car Safety</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageRange_1" class="content_page_range">4 of 8 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_339"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">Take Action: <span>Poisons</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <h3>Keep medicines and cleaning products out of your child’s reach.</h3>
               <ul>
                <li>Keep medicines, vitamins, dietary supplements, cleaning supplies, and other poisons (like batteries and bug spray) out of reach and out of sight.</li>
                <li>Always relock the safety cap after you use a medicine.</li>
                <li>Put things like cleaning products away right after every use.</li>
                <li>Put the poison control number (1-800-222-1222) on or near every home telephone, and save it in your cell phone. Poison control is always open.</li>
                <li><a href="http://www.cdc.gov/HomeandRecreationalSafety/Poisoning/preventiontips.htm" target="_blank">Get more tips to protect your child from poisoning</a>.</li>
               </ul> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_topic_navigation_2" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNextLabel_2" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNext_2" class="button next" href="#take-action_4">Smoke Alarms</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrevLabel_2" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrev_2" class="button previous" href="#take-action_2">Water Safety</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageRange_2" class="content_page_range">5 of 8 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_330"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">Take Action: <span>Smoke Alarms</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <h3>Put smoke alarms on every floor of your home.</h3>
               <p>Use long-life smoke alarms if possible. These alarms use lithium batteries and last longer than regular smoke alarms. They also have a “hush button” so you can stop the alarm quickly if there’s a false&nbsp;alarm.</p>
               <p>If you use regular smoke alarms, replace the batteries every year. To help you remember, change your smoke alarm batteries when you change your clocks back from daylight saving&nbsp;time in the fall.</p>
               <p>Follow these other tips on smoke alarms:</p>
               <ul>
                <li>Test your smoke alarms once a month by pushing the test button.</li>
                <li>Put smoke alarms on every floor of your home and near places where people sleep.</li>
                <li>Don’t forget to put a smoke alarm in the basement.</li>
                <li>Replace your smoke alarm if it doesn’t work when tested or if it’s more than 10 years old.</li>
                <li>Dust or vacuum smoke alarms when you change the batteries.</li>
                <li>Never disable or take down smoke alarms. If an alarm goes off because you are cooking, use the hush button, open a window, or fan the alarm with a towel to clear the air.</li>
                <li><a href="http://www.usfa.fema.gov/downloads/fief/handouts/fief_smoke_alarm_flyer.pdf" target="_blank">Get more fire safety&nbsp;tips [PDF - 3 MB]</a>.</li>
               </ul>
               <p><strong>Make a fire escape plan for your home. </strong><br><a href="http://www.nfpa.org/public-education/by-topic/safety-in-the-home/escape-planning/basic-fire-escape-planning" target="_blank">Make a fire escape plan</a>&nbsp;to get out of your home quickly in an emergency. Be sure your plan includes a safe place away from the house where everyone can meet.</p> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_topic_navigation_3" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNextLabel_3" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNext_3" class="button next" href="#take-action_5">Playgrounds and Sports</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrevLabel_3" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrev_3" class="button previous" href="#take-action_3">Poisons</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageRange_3" class="content_page_range">6 of 8 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation -->

             <div class="page" id="page_338"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">Take Action: <span>Playgrounds and Sports</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <h3>Play safely.</h3>
               <p>Make sure your child wears a helmet during activities&nbsp;like&nbsp;riding a bike or skateboarding.</p>
               <p>Use helmets and other safety gear to help protect your child’s head, face, wrists, elbows, and knees.</p>
               <p>At the playground, check for soft landing spots under swings, slides, and climbers. Landing spots made of mulch, sand, or rubber mats are safer than grass and&nbsp;dirt.</p>
               <p><a href="https://www.cpsc.gov/safety-education/safety-guides/playgrounds/public-playground-safety-checklist" target="_blank">Use this playground safety checklist</a> to help make sure your local playground is a safe place to play.</p>
               <p>Get more tips to protect your kids from:</p>
               <ul>
                <li><a href="http://www.cdc.gov/safechild/Sports_Injuries/index.html" target="_blank">Sports injuries</a></li>
                <li><a href="http://www.cdc.gov/safechild/Falls/index.html" target="_blank">Falls</a></li>
               </ul> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_topic_navigation_4" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNextLabel_4" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNext_4" class="button next" href="#take-action_6">Sleep Safety</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrevLabel_4" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrev_4" class="button previous" href="#take-action_4">Smoke Alarms</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageRange_4" class="content_page_range">7 of 8 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_857"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">Take Action: <span>Sleep Safety</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <h3>Keep your baby safe during sleep.</h3>
               <p>Suffocation is when a person can’t breathe. Babies are most at risk for suffocation when they sleep.</p>
               <p>To help your baby sleep safely:</p>
               <ul>
                <li>Always put your baby to sleep on his or her&nbsp;back, even for naps.</li>
                <li>Use a firm sleep surface, like a crib mattress that's been approved for safety.&nbsp;</li>
                <li>Never put your baby to sleep on a soft surface, like a bed, couch, or chair.</li>
                <li>Use a fitted sheet. Keep loose bedding, soft objects, toys, and crib bumpers out of the sleep area.</li>
                <li>Share a room with your baby – but not a bed.</li>
                <li><a href="https://healthfinder.gov/HealthTopics/Category/pregnancy/getting-ready-for-your-baby/keep-your-baby-safe-during-sleep" target="_blank">Learn more about how to keep your baby safe during sleep</a>.</li>
               </ul> 
              </div>

                <span class="content_page_link right"> </span>
